intro: Sisymbrium pectinatum, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its leaves are pinnately lobed with a distinctive pectinate arrangement. Sisymbrium pectinatum is an annual herb that can grow up to 1 meter tall, with a taproot system that allows it to survive in various soil conditions. Its seeds are small and contained in a siliqua, which is a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family.
